hero_organizationName: German Center for Open Source AI Software Research
hero_headline: AI that belongs to you, democratically governed, for the benefit of society
hero_subheadline: GC.OS is the German Center for Open Source AI and empowers organizations and individuals to harness the power of open source artificial intelligence through democratic governance and community-driven innovation.
vision_title: Why Democratic Open Source AI Matters
vision_description: In an era where AI shapes our future, we believe that artificial intelligence should belong to the people, be democratically governed, and designed for the benefit of society. Open Source AI ensures transparency, accountability, and equal access to transformative technology.
targetAudience_organizations_description: We help companies adopt Open Source AI through consulting, implementation support, and strategic guidance.
targetAudience_individuals_description: Learn AI through mentoring, courses, and hands-on workshops designed for all skill levels.
targetAudience_developers_description: Get support for your Open Source AI projects through fellowships, governance frameworks, and community resources.
projects_sktime_description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series
projects_featureEngine_description: A Python library for feature engineering and selection
howWeWork_principles_democratic_descript: Decisions are made collectively by our community
howWeWork_principles_openSource_descript: We prioritize Open Source solutions and transparency
howWeWork_principles_community_descripti: Our work is run by and for the community
howWeWork_principles_impact_description: Everything we do serves the common good
services_consulting_description: Expert consulting for your AI initiatives
services_projectSupport_description: Resources and funding for Open Source AI projects
cta_title: Ready to join the Open Source AI movement?
faq_q1_answer: Open Source means that a software's source code is publicly accessible and can be viewed, used, modified, and distributed by anyone. Unlike proprietary software controlled by individual companies, Open Source belongs to the community. This creates transparency, fosters innovation through collaboration, and ensures that technology is not monopolized in the hands of a few. For AI systems, this is particularly important: Open Source AI enables everyone to understand how decisions are made and adapt the technology to their own needs.
faq_q2_question: What does "democratically governed" Open Source AI mean?
faq_q2_answer: Democratically governed Open Source AI goes beyond freely accessible code. It means that decisions about the development, direction, and use of AI projects are made transparently and with active community participation. Instead of individual companies or institutions setting the direction, all stakeholders – developers, users, and organizations – have a voice. At GC.OS, we promote governance structures that enable this democratic participation. This ensures that AI technology is developed in the interest of society and remains sustainable, fair, and trustworthy in the long term.
faq_q3_question: How does GC.OS support Open Source developers?
faq_q3_answer: We create the framework conditions so developers can focus on what they do best: developing great software. GC.OS provides the legal and organizational framework for Open Source AI projects – from license consulting to governance structures to administrative support. Through our fellowships, developers receive financial support and can work full-time on their projects. Additionally, we offer career development, networking with the community, and access to resources. This allows developers to put their energy into innovation while we handle the organizational framework.
faq_q4_question: How does GC.OS support companies and organizations?
faq_q4_answer: We accompany companies and organizations in successfully implementing Open Source AI systems. Our consulting services include analyzing your specific requirements, identifying suitable Open Source solutions, and developing customized implementation strategies. We help you choose the right tools, overcome technical hurdles, and empower your teams. You benefit from our deep expertise in the Open Source community and our network of leading AI projects. Our goal: you use AI technology effectively, cost-efficiently, and independently of individual providers.
faq_q5_question: How does GC.OS support individual users and learners?
faq_q5_answer: We make Open Source AI accessible to everyone – regardless of prior knowledge. Through our mentoring programs, you are personally guided and supported by experienced experts. Our educational content, from beginner courses to advanced workshops, teaches you the practical skills you need to work with Open Source AI. Additionally, we offer regular events where you can network with the community and learn from others. Whether you want to advance your career, start your own project, or simply understand how AI works – we support you on your journey.
courses_metadata_description: Discover upcoming GC.OS courses, live workshops, and community-driven training sessions focused on practical open-source AI skills.
courses_hero_subheadline: Hands-on courses that translate open-source AI methods into your workflow. Small cohorts, practical projects, and mentors straight from the GC.OS network.
courses_featured_section_title: Automation that clicks in one afternoon
courses_featured_card_title: n8n intro course with Tobias Glöckler
courses_featured_card_summary: Build resilient automations with n8n, learn the GC.OS blueprint for documenting workflows, and leave with two battle-tested integrations you can deploy immediately.
courses_featured_card_imageAlt: Illustration of interconnected automation nodes for the n8n course
courses_catalog_section_description: Pick the track that fits your current challenge—whether you need automation superpowers or want to reason about causal systems.
courses_catalog_card_pgmpy_summary: Co-create probabilistic graphical models, learn how pgmpy structures complex domains, and practice debugging real causal graphs from civic tech projects.
courses_catalog_card_pgmpy_imageAlt: Whiteboard sketch of causal arrows used in the pgmpy course

about_metadata_description: Learn more about GC.OS, our mission, vision, and how we're building a democratic future for Open Source AI.
about_hero_subheadline: GC.OS is the German Center for Open Source AI and empowers organizations and individuals to harness the power of open source artificial intelligence through democratic governance and community-driven innovation.
about_story_problem: AI is increasingly controlled by a few tech corporations, creating a power imbalance that threatens democratic values and equal access to transformative technology.
about_story_vision: We envision a world where AI is democratic, transparent, and accessible to all. A future where decisions about AI development are made collectively, not by a select group.
about_story_solution: GC.OS bridges this gap by providing the legal, organizational, and financial framework that Open Source AI projects need to thrive. We enable developers, organizations, and individuals to participate in shaping the future of AI.
about_mission_missionDescription: We support Open Source AI projects through fellowships, governance structures, and legal frameworks. We offer mentoring, education, and consulting to empower individuals and organizations to leverage Open Source AI solutions.
about_mission_visionDescription: A democratic AI landscape where technology serves society, not corporate interests. A world where AI development is transparent, accountable, and accessible to all.
about_mission_values_transparency_descri: Open processes, open code, open decisions
about_mission_values_commonGood_descript: Technology that serves society, not just shareholders
about_mission_values_openSource_descript: We prioritize Open Source solutions and transparency
about_whatWeDo_projectSupport_descriptio: We promote Open Source AI projects through fellowships, governance support, and legal frameworks. From license consulting to administrative support, we enable developers to focus on innovation.
about_whatWeDo_education_description: Courses, mentoring programs, and events for individuals to develop their AI expertise. From beginner workshops to advanced training, we make Open Source AI accessible to everyone.
about_whatWeDo_consulting_description: Expert consulting for organizations implementing Open Source AI. We help you analyze requirements, identify solutions, and develop customized implementation strategies.
about_impact_description: Through our programs, we have created measurable impact in the Open Source AI ecosystem.
about_projects_description: An overview of the main projects we support
about_partners_description: We are part of a growing ecosystem of organizations and individuals committed to democratic AI.
about_legal_meaning: As a non-profit organization, we are committed to the common good. This means transparency, democratic governance, and that donations are tax-deductible for donors.
about_legal_governance: Our governance structure ensures that decisions are made democratically, with input from our community and stakeholders.
projects_metadata_description: Discover the open source AI projects supported by GC.OS. From time series analysis to probabilistic modeling, explore tools that are shaping the future of AI.
projects_hero_subheadline: We support and nurture open source AI projects that are democratically governed and built for the benefit of society. Explore the projects under our umbrella.

donate_metadata_description: Support open source AI development. Donations to GC.OS are tax-deductible.
donate_hero_subheadline: Your donation supports the development of democratically governed Open Source AI projects for the benefit of society.
donate_projectDonation_description: To donate to a specific project supported by GC.OS, please include the project name(s) in the "purpose" field of your bank transfer.
donate_taxDeductible_description: Donations to GC.OS are tax-deductible. For smaller donations (up to a few hundred EUR), a bank receipt may be sufficient to claim deductions, depending on your tax country.
donate_receipt_description: To request a donation receipt (Spendenquittung), please send your details to us via email, together with any requirements regarding the receipt.
donate_contact_description: If you wish to donate towards a more specific purpose or have questions about your donation, please contact us:
